links: D. W. Boyd, Linear recurrence relations for some generalized Pisot sequences, Advances in Number Theory ( Kingston ON, 1991) 333-340, Oxford Sci. Publ., Oxford Univ. Press, New York, 1993.
formula: a(n) = 3*a(n-1) - 2*a(n-2) + a(n-3) - a(n-6) (holds at least up to n = 1000 but is not known to hold in general).
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 2, a[1] == 5, a[n] == Floor[a[n - 1]^2/a[n - 2]]}, a, {n, 0, 40}] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 04 2016 *)
prog: (MAGMA) Iv:=[2,5]; [n le 2 select Iv[n] else Floor(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2)): n in [1..40]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 04 2016
crossrefs: See A008776 for definitions of Pisot sequences.
author: _R. K. Guy_
